website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for an affordable DEWALT drill, you won't find a kit that has more to offer for the cost.
pros: Compact design makes it incredibly nimble for smaller jobs
Its durability rivals models that are more than twice the price
cons: Not powerful enough for contractor-strength jobs, but it still offers impressive power

website_summaries.verdict: Well-priced. A hugely popular kit, and for good reason.
pros: Nothing beats it for torque output
Lots of different kit/set variations, so you can choose the drill kit for your needs
Ergonomic handle and lightweight design makes it easy to handle, even in tight spaces
cons: A bit heavier than the other drills we tested

customer_reviews.title: Battery won't charge. Not used much.
customer_reviews.text: I have blearily used this so far. Works well, but the second battery would not charge as shipped to me. I just kept using the same battery in the pack, but I had a project the other weekend that required me to change out the battery several time. The second one would not charge at all. I'm trying to contact the company so maybe I can send this defective one back to them or something. Will update the review accordingly. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Indre

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drill.  Came with Dead Battery.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good drill. The kit came with one battery that wouldn’t take a charge. No luck with the help center chat (timed out waiting for an agent.)
customer_reviews.author: John Balgavy

customer_reviews.title: Mine stopped working in a month
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's too long to return it I think. But just in less then a month the two batteries don't charge enough or the drill itself doesn't work. Who knows. All I know is I'm getting not enough charge for anywork I need. I need to buy another and this time, I'll use a big box store.
customer_reviews.author: S. Altenau

customer_reviews.title: Both batteries went bad. Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage, both batteries went bad after 2 months. Tried contacting manufacturer with no luck
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: this junk has quit this after two months of use not happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS DRILL!!! The battery ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS DRILL !!! The battery has problems and the drill will die after the first couple of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment, buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Dewalt even tough there were a few negative reviews. I charged both batteries and started on replacing three hinges on a door project that I had been putting off. The first battery lasted long enough to remove 2 hinges (6 screws). The second battery failed after removing 2 -1 1/2 long screws. I had an old Dewalt, that I used to finish the job strong!! Thank god again for AMAZON!! I explained my issue to an assistant in a Chat and within 2 minutes I received a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Vision1tactical

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure to Fully Insert the Battery into the Charger
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen a lot of complaints about the batteries. I thought I had problems with my batteries as well and almost returned the drill until I realize I was not snapping the battery into the charger fully. Once I did that the batteries charged up as expected and provided days of power for me. Make sure you are completely inserting your battery into the charger. It should click into place.
customer_reviews.author: R. White

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and performance drill
customer_reviews.text: High quality drill kit here. It feels nice in the hand. Good balance. Bag is perfect size and not cheap looking which is a plus. Two batteries is convenient. More than enough power for home or garage projects. For price of $100 you do really get your monies worth. 90 day money back guarantee and a limited 3 year warranty is appreciated. Worth buying. I can totally recommend this drill at this price.
customer_reviews.author: MaXimus421

customer_reviews.title: Both Batteries Defective
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked it, both batteries showed they were fully charged. Used it on a few screws, battery one died after about 2 minutes. Put that battery on the charger and it said it was fully changed?!? Decided to leave it in the charger anyway. Put in battery number two. That battery only lasted 30 seconds. Put it in the charger and it too said it was fully charged. Was unable to finish the project I started. Very disappointed. Sent it back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much more powerful than my $49 Black and Decker! It's a decent size and weight. The two speeds are nice but I really just prefer one to do it all and keep it simple. I've used it on a few projects so far and there's really nothing to complain about. Unfortunately one of the battery packs included was dead on arrival. It only runs the drill for 30 seconds before dying even after a full charge. The highest voltage it will hit is 15.2v. I called Dewalt and spoke with them...I was supposed to get an email about returning the battery but haven't seen anything. I'm afraid I'm stuck with a bad battery.
customer_reviews.author: mjamazon

customer_reviews.title: Twice bitten, now shy...
customer_reviews.text: Either I'm too ignorant to operate this drill after 15 years of rehabbing houses, or I got 2 bad eggs in a row. I'd put a fresh battery in and it would start fast then slow down to nothing, even not drilling anything. I'd swap batteries-same thing. If I failed to understand how to operate it correctly then it is too complicated for the simple tasks of drilling for which it was purchased. I'm going to buy a different brand next time. Very disappointed in you on this product, Dewalt! My cheap Black & Decker is more useful than this one! Amazon, however, gave fabulous customer support on the problematic returns.
customer_reviews.author: Ruffslitch

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Usually when you see "Dewalt" you think of quality. This drill however is pure junk! The light stays on running the battery down, the batteries last about 2 minutes each, then when you place them on the charger it says they're fully charged when they're not! You could buy a "great value" drill and it would exceed the performance by 1000%. Biggest waste of a hundred bucks ever!
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT  drill/driver.
customer_reviews.text: I need ed to replace my original DEWALT drill since I lost both batteries for that drill. I searched on line for replacement batteries for that drill, and found they were very expensive. I saw this drill in a package that included two batteries and charger for slightly more than the replacement batteries. The new drill performs as well, or better than the old one. It also can use the bigger 5.0 DEWALT batteries that I use in my leaf blower, grass trimmer, and hedge trimmer. It was one of my best buys to add too my DEWALT collection of battery operated tools.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H.

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Drill is what you would expect from Dewalt as good quality. Battery’s are useless as they are not full size and only last about 10 minutes. Charger is low quality also and takes for ever to charge your batteries even if you have other really good batteries. The reason it is such a good deal is because only the drill is useful.. had to go out and buy new charger and batteries.
customer_reviews.author: honestlynow

customer_reviews.title: chuck problems.
customer_reviews.text: There is a grinding sound coming from the chuck after 2 months of use. It still chucks up bits, but it sounds like it's 100 years old already. Everything else about the drill it great, and it still works, but sounds terrible, and I don't think that the three jaws of the chuck move together to tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Conway

customer_reviews.title: Not the Dewalt of yesteryear
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. The drill bits constantly fell off. The torque wasn’t too adjustable . I didn’t like the abrupt stoppage with a huge spark( I guess this means it’s not brushless).I wanted to love it and it is very well built in MEXICO not CHINA oh and BTW Mexico is in central AMERICA!!! Yeah there are actually 3 Americas.🤪 In any case I’m switching back to BOSCH love everything they make and my dishwasher is now 20 years old!!!
customer_reviews.author: LordOlux

customer_reviews.title: Why did DeWalt get rid of the bit holder below the handle?!
customer_reviews.text: The 1.3 amp hour batteries lack status buttons to see battery life. That's not a deal breaker, however. What is a deal breaker is that DeWalt did away with the bit holder below the handle. The are still has room to store a bit, but they removed it so they can sell accessories to add later. Accessories that won't work with their 3 amp hour batteries (the batteries are wider and hit the add ons). That's a bit ridiculous. DeWalt should know better.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: No more power cords
customer_reviews.text: This is a very excellent tool. You can set the torque to lightly handle small screws or to drive 3-inch exterior screws into yellow pine. The balance is almost perfect. The new batteries out of the box only take about one hour each to come to a full charge. As another reviewer said, remember to fully seat the batteries into the charger or you'll have charging problems. If I ever lose this tool, I'd buy another in a minute. One of the best tool purchases I've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Have you ever been complimented by another man about your drill? I have....
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice drill... A seriously nice drill... Battery life? ✓ (about a days worth of work) Charging time? ✓ Ruggedness? ✓ Solid materials? ✓ Ease of use? ✓ Does it drill? ✓ Is it powerful? ✓ Does it come with unnecessary swag? ✓ Is it black and yellow? ✓ Tiny light? ✓ You know how something just feels solid, That "damn this thing is nice," feeling? I've been doing a lot of home renovations and decided to invest into a good drill, and after some research came to the Dewalt DCD771C2 20V MAX. I don't know how I even worked without this thing before.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L.

customer_reviews.title: Spend your money some place else.
customer_reviews.text: I cant describe how disappointed I am. I should have flushed the money down the toilet. I used this drill once for about 10 minutes. put it away. Next time i went to use it nothing a vary slow spin or two. I went to charge the battery. it showed it had a full charge. I tested on a volt meter it also showed full charge both batteries! Batteries tested in a different device, and the work fine. I is definitely the drill. Forget about customer service. Apparently DeWalt doesn't care after you spend your money...Not the company it once was. I will NEVER use or buy anything from them EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt impossible to contact for customer support
customer_reviews.text: I tried contacting Dewalt through its online chat and email processes, but these always failed even after a dozen attempts. One of the lithium-ion batteries cannot hold a charge, so I think Dewalt should replace it. Since I cannot contact Dewalt, I'm out of luck. Big disappointment since I've been a long time Dewalt customer.
customer_reviews.author: Marthemarkmex

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for husband. We are doing a fireplace remodel. He has been using this drill every day. He had a very inexpensive cordless drill for 19 years and the battery finally died. This is a big update for him. He loves it and kept mentioning it is a good drill. The battery has been performing well, so well that he does not need to recharge it every day. Almost every thing I ordered from amazon came on time except for one item that was delayed by the local delivery service. That was not a big deal at all as I do not need it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Ping

customer_reviews.title: Avoid like the plague
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews about the sparks inside of the drill I thought what are the chances this would happen to me? Well it did it was defective from the beginning. Had the sparks after letting go of the trigger. Also the main reason I returned it was because of the poor battery life. Yes I charged it properly and even made sure it clicked all the way into the charger. But I went through 2 1/2 batteries doing a simple car detail with a drill brush set. There’s no way using this for a hour should of killed 2 batteries. Will not buy this product ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Maxine

customer_reviews.title: Dead battery
customer_reviews.text: My kids all 3 chipped in their money to buy this for father's day for their dad. He was excited to receive it until he went to use it. 1 battery worked ok but the other one is just dead. It never worked. Charged it several times and it's no good. My kids were upset because they paid a lot of money. The drill runs great with the 1 battery but when you're supposed to get 2 batteries and only 1 works, it's maddening.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Klein

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery and chuck slips
customer_reviews.text: Chuck slips and after one month one of the battery's will not keep a charge. Not worth my time and effort to box back up and send back. I know better now not to buy any Dewalt products online through Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why this is as inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to get to the point of recognizing that you need to pay for good tools, but I have, and I now believe in Dewalt. I have owned an 18v Dewalt drll for many years, so when shopping for a second/backup drill (March 2020), I looked for Dewalt again and expected to dig deeper into my pocket than $99. This one is smaller than my older drill, which I think is a plus, it has a light, a carry bag, plus a charger and TWO batteries. I have no problem recommending this product.
customer_reviews.author: John Schmit

customer_reviews.title: The batteries don't hold for more than 50-60 screws
customer_reviews.text: The drill delivers anything it promises. Unfortunately, it also delivers what some reviews said, very short battery life - About 50-60 wood screws until the battery dies and by the time you finished the spare battery, the 1st one isn't even remotely charged. Efficient for Micro projects only. As this is obviously a known issue, it appears that dewalt are aware of the problem and instead of recalling all those batteries, they use Amazon and sale this rubbish as a "Deal". Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: the drill didn't hold bits tight enough from new, I lost several bits on the floor and more in pieces of wood, it constantly dropped bits, so frustrating. After 6 months the torque adjuster jammed and dewalt wouldn't replace the drill. I only bought this drill to replace an 8 year old dewalt whose batteries had died, it was cheaper to buy the drill than batteries, wish I'd bought from another manufacturer, will do so from now on
customer_reviews.author: trigger

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt takes advantage of their reputation with this thing UPDATE  its dead
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE--it smoked and is dead!!!!!!!!!! no one honors warranties anymore!!!!!!!!!! This is really expensive for a marginal power drill with terrible batteries that have little life. It has less power than a harbor freight cordless drill I bought to use waiting for this to arrive. Batteries go dead real quick, should have came with one decent one instead of two terrible ones.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Used at our shop on the Farm
customer_reviews.text: We use this Dewalt on the farm. We use it to assist us with odds and ends. There is always something to fix when you work on a farm / equipment / anything and everything. The battery life is as promised. Long lasting. The Built in light is bright and it comes in handy for dim-lit spots. The Dewalt is easy to handle / hold. The grip works well, even with greased up hands. The Dewalt is powerful. It is just what we needed to have around the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Project completion perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Father's Day gift for my husband and he LOVES it! He's already put it to great use completing projects on his "honey-do" list! So I love it too!!!
customer_reviews.author: NurseB

customer_reviews.title: Thought I had a great drill until I got my hands on this Dewalt!
customer_reviews.text: In love with this tool. One of my first power tools by Dewalt and I got to say I’m very impressed. Little disappointed that Dewalt did not include a Phillips/flathead driver and an area to attach it to the drill. More disappointed in the fact it’s $10 for just the attachment piece. This minor detail keeps me from giving this a 5 star rating. It’s the little things ya know.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name (required)

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life, otherwise wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drill after extensive research for my husband for his birthday. I probably use it more than he does (lol!). Overall, it’s a very good drill. The only complaint is that the battery is less than stellar. I’ve come to find that having one battery always on the charger is beneficial. I know that seems like common sense, but the battery that has been on the charger, fully charged, for the past 3 days, seems to last longer than the battery that was taken off the charger once it was fully charged and set off to the side. Besides that, wonderful drill & no other complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Miah

customer_reviews.title: Husband was Delighted - Said Dewalt is best tool made -Better than Other Named Brand Tools
customer_reviews.text: My husband received this for father's day. He was very excited. We just purchased a 32' camper, and it is the right size for him to raise and lower the jacks. He used it today on a side project he was doing. He is going to throw his older name brand one away that refuses to keep a charge. Oh, and one other thing - this exact drill was listed at a local store on sale (saying it was discounted $50.00) for the exact price I purchased it on Amazon. I would say that is an excellent deal in itself. Another reason why Prime pays for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Old Soul

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck, especially if you lost your charger for another tool.
customer_reviews.text: Wow great bang for your buck. I lost the charger for my impact and was dead in the water. A new charger is like $75, this gives you two batteries and a drill to go along with the charger for another $20. I have Ryobi green ones for on the road or in locations where theft is an issue. The dewalts seem to float away easy if you don't keep an eye on them. These impacts and drills pound in the screws and will drill holes in 4x4s all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Rodesch

customer_reviews.title: Terrible power and poor torque
customer_reviews.text: Used this drill for light drilling after purchasing it about a month ago. Very disappointed in the power. It doesn’t want to maintain its torque when it’s been going through a quarter inch piece of plywood. Very disappointed. Hope to be able to get a refund or return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill for what I have to do.
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill. Its really came in handy and I haven't noticed any issues with it during the work that I have conducted. It is kinda heavy but you may get used to it after a few goes. Couple of projects I used it for are: Replaced some very old fence panels that were screwed in for a picket fence. Used it while replacing some HVAC parts, sheet metal and electric panel. I use it for small stuff like putting holes in new pplanters.just random stuff for now and one battery seems to last a very very long time like a few days. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ilan

customer_reviews.title: Very solid drill
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a Black & Decker drill that couldn't hold a charge for beyond 10 minutes, this thing almost terrified me with its power. Then I remembered this is how a drill is supposed to feel like and everything was fine. Two batteries, solid construction, and an LED light make for a real nice drill. The simplicity in attaching a bit is helpful and the ability to accurately adjust the speed of the drill is helpful when you're trying to get it juuust right. It does what it's supposed to do and it does it very well. Two batteries included is a real nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: David T. Kreal

customer_reviews.title: GIRL LOVES DRILL
customer_reviews.text: I love this cordless drill! I don't know why I haven't purchased one sooner. It was a toss up between DeWalt and Milwaukee, but I ended up with DeWalt because I got a tiny discount through my place of employment. Projects go so much faster when one has the right tools! I've been driving 3-1/2" deck screws into some 2X4's and they go in so easily (I always drill pilot holes.) The weight of the tool is not heavy and the battery life, so far, has been as expected. Very easy to operate. Now I need a table saw and a cordless nailer and I'll be set!
customer_reviews.author: CarharP

customer_reviews.title: 2 Drills and 2 Returns
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. That’s what this drill is. The first one had a bad battery so I received a new drill and battery as an exchange. The 2nd drill gear broke while putting a wood screw in a 2x4!!! DeWalt brand is nowhere near as good as Craftsman...where I’m going back to.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fusek

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I was helping a friend build his Man Cave and used his tools and drank his beer while I helped him with putting up walls, dividers, on the wall TV bracket and lighting. I noticed how good and powerful the DEWALT drill was made so I bought one and i'm glad I did. This is a rugged man's tool and I recommend it for every Handyman's tool box.
customer_reviews.author: khadam

customer_reviews.title: Cheated by DeWalt
customer_reviews.text: Beware, this product came in a box that had been opened before I got it. Inside were 2 1.3AH batteries, but the box says that the batteries are 1.5AH. It looks to me like the reseller cheapened the batteries before selling it to me. Still seems to be a reasonable deal, but it is disappointing that I will need to buy real batteries before I can take on any serious projects. I was expecting nothing smaller than 2AH, but it seems that DeWalt created smaller batteries to put in the kits when you buy the drill. That is not the way to create customer loyalty, including substandard batteries for the initial use of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: Good product,  great price
customer_reviews.text: Like the size. Haven't used enough on big projects to comment battery life. It is nice to just pull it out and get a quick job done. I like that it came with two batteries.
customer_reviews.author: SoccerTopper

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like this drill. It's very compact, has a 1/2 inch chuck, pretty powerful and has a good battery life. The only thing I hate about this drill is the dang light. Who the hell would put a light right underneath the trigger so that it casts a shadow onto the work piece. Its a ridiculous design for a otherwise outstanding drill. I gotta knock a star off for that. I would definitely buy this drill again though.....As a matter of fact, this is my second one. One for the cottage, and one for home.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: Great handy size device for all kinds of project work
customer_reviews.text: Great handy size device for all kinds of project work. Lightweight and easy to use. Extra battery and charger needed for continuous use in high demand work conditions. Strong enough to drill 2 1/2" cores for mounting door hardware. Arrived on time. Better price than Home Depot or Menards. (Neither would honor a price match to the online sale price)
customer_reviews.author: George M. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Great drilll but battery charger is finniky
customer_reviews.text: The drill works great and the battery life is quite good. I would give this 5 stars if it were not for the battery charger. It is a bit tricky and it takes several attempts to get the charger to recognize a discharged battery. However, after having to mess with the charger for a couple minutes to get it to recognize the battery, it then works fine. The drill is extremely powerful and I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: G. RIchards

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt no longer a reputable name.
customer_reviews.text: DeWalt used to be a brand you could trust. My 7yr old 12V DeWalt outshines this thing. My old batteries hold a better charge than the new ones! (New one lost charge after 20minutes of constant use after a full charge!) It's WAY heavier. The top end is too heavy to be equal with the battery. Really disappointed in this product and plan to issue a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: I particularly like the locking mechanism for the drill bits
customer_reviews.text: Very compact system. Comes with two batteries so you have a spare battery. It does not come with any drill bits. The drill itself works well. I particularly like the locking mechanism for the drill bits. It’s not a Milwaukie but still seems pretty sturdy. The battery died out pretty quickly and I had to charge it quite often. Not sure if the initial charge on the battery was not a full charge.
customer_reviews.author: babiesrfatTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good driver/drill
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research before opting for this particular brand/model. I am glad I did. So far, it has done a very good job. The battery life on it, however, isn't very good. It is a good thing it comes with two, otherwise it would be quite frustrating to have to halt the project while waiting for the battery to fill again, which one would need to do rather often. So that is a point that the company could definitely improve on. Other than the quick battery drain, I have been very happy with the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sagey

customer_reviews.title: Gutless
customer_reviews.text: My first (and hopefully only) DeWalt disappointment. This drill is so weak that just drilling a hole through a 2x4 was a real chore for this drill. Very disappointed, especially given how many DeWalt products I own. This one time disspointment though will not derail any future purchases of fine DeWalt products.
customer_reviews.author: JohnWR

customer_reviews.title: Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Such a beautiful tool. I love the intuition made in creating it. Perfect size for ladies hands. Does not feel overwhelming to use. Ithink this is a great deal for a solid product that will last a long time. Strong power as well. I have used it so much already in just a few shortweeks.
customer_reviews.author: Anm

customer_reviews.title: Drill just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Died just after a year, when the warranty was up. Very disappointed in Dewalt. They seem to have gone downhill
customer_reviews.author: Carlos H.

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISSAPOINTED!
customer_reviews.text: I love DeWalt. When you go into my shop all you see is School Bus YELLOW.... ISSUES...Right out of the box 1) RUN-OUT! HUGE HUGE RUN-OUT! I thought I had put in a Bent Drill bit or got it in the chuck crooked. NOPE the chuck just wobbles around ! 2) When you let off the trigger it comes to instant stop with as loud CRACK. I thought the clutch might be set funny NO!! I thought it has some sort of BRAKE ... NO just a sharp loud CRACK! 3) Bits keep falling out.. THIS IS YELLOW because it's a LEMON! Maybe Blue this time!
customer_reviews.author: Carl T.

customer_reviews.title: Best drill I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is sick - one charge lasted all day and part of the next under heavy use. The batteries charge quickly compared to how long the charge lasts. The drill was used to make holes in pine and 2X4’s and to drive 2-1/2” & 3” screws into plywood and 2X4’s that were not pre-drilled. I bought this drill to replace one I got at Harbor Freight that died after two days of similar use. You get what you pay for. This drill is a real work horse and comfortable to use. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: alfisch

customer_reviews.title: not a match for the 18.8V
customer_reviews.text: DeWalt has dropped the ball badly with this product. It might make a good tool for the in home tool box but it does not have the torque or power of the 18.8v. The batteries do not hold a charge a long as the 18.8v did. The only advantage and the reason I gave it a 2 instead of a 1 rating is due to its reduced weight. If you need power, torque, and stamina the 20v drill is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: T. Irons

customer_reviews.title: Half dead on arrival. Fully dead in 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived with one battery that was 100% dead. Wouldn't hold a charge and the drill wouldn't turn on. Whatever, I still had 1 working battery and I am far from a power user. Well, fast forward a couple of months and now either the drill or the other battery is dead. I'm stuck with a paper weight until I figure out how to either fix it of send it in for warranty. I live in an apartment and I use this to build IKEA furniture and drill holes to mount shelves. Definitely nothing heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Battery dies instantly
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a Dewalt, feels like a Dewalt.....not sure its actually a Dewalt. Battery lasts about 3 min of regular screws into wood then does not turn at all. Put it back on the charger...same thing...both batteries. Got easy full refund. Not sure if it has to do with shipping it to Hawaii or if this is just a knockoff.....?
customer_reviews.author: E. Kraus

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for the Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting one of these for myself for years. My father has always used Dewalt drills and I figured it was time to purchase one for myself. It was $99 when I purchased it and it is worth every penny. The backup battery is a lifesaver. It is lightweight enough that I can use it for long periods of time without my arm aching. It would be a great gift for someone else or even yourself. The multi-torque is really useful for different jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Happy Mother's Day To Me!!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase. My old drill disappeared but this replacement is in a whole new class. I love the worklight, and the fact that it stays lit just a little after you let go of the trigger. The fact that it comes with two batteries means I don't have to wait for a recharge (which I've never had to do since the charge lasts awhile). And I'm thrilled with the bag since it means I can easily keep the drill, batteries, and drill and driver bits all together.
customer_reviews.author: G. Faria

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. I get why they added a second battery as a battery will typically last for a few hours. The good news the battery will be fully charged by the time the other one dies! Good weight and balance. The light is helpful for my old man eyes.
customer_reviews.author: gdefond

customer_reviews.title: GREAT battery, powerful and gentle!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I could screw mine and my neighbors houses together with this thing. It's got so much power! I can drill through a stud with ease and on the flip side, it's gentle enough whenever I'm handling some electronic repairs (reel to reel, stereos, computers, etc). The battery life is FANTASTIC! I literally havent had to charge it in over a month and it's kept it's juice. The LED light on the end seems to be a tad off, but hey, it has a light where I didnt have one before! I can't recommend this one enough!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it’s too early to send the review but I like it so used it but I haven’t used it very heavily like all day every time I use it the batteries good so I like the two speeds and the two batteries the charger seems to be working excellent I hope the batteries last me a long time
customer_reviews.author: sosa

customer_reviews.title: It has worked great! We used it to drill into our concrete ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill for projects around the house. It has worked great! We used it to drill into our concrete walls to hang a coat rack, and didn't have any problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha C Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than my replacement batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with my old DeWalt cordless drill, but 7 yrs later the batteries are not lasting long. Checked Amazon for replacement batteries, and found this drill with 2 batteries, charger, and bag for the same price as the replacement batteries! I know it was $70.00 less because of a sale, but the fact that it's new, has a warranty, and the batteries are the same as my old unit made it a no brainer!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: High quality, high power
customer_reviews.text: After disassembling my child's old baby crib with this, I was thinking "oh man, why didn't I just pay up and get this from the first place?" I was suffering with a cheap 10 or 12V cordless drill from IKEA, that was not providing enough torque uninstall the screws, or drill holes into the wall for home projects. All those problems, gone now with this. There is very high quality in the feel of the overall hardware and motor operation, which helps home improvement jobs feel less of a drag.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Koko

customer_reviews.title: 20V batteries last forever. Comes with 2 batteries, but no driver bits.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded because I can't find the older one after we moved. This is a nice deal for a solid drill/driver. I didn't read the fine print, so I was pleased to get 2 batteries. Since I already have plenty of driver bits, not getting any wasn't much of a problem.. If you don't have drill / driver bits, be sure to order them separately. Low speed is variable and torque settings are solid, so I've yet to strip a head/thread/pilot hole. It can keep up with tougher stuff that needs more power. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: neocaster

customer_reviews.title: Four year of faithful service ain't bad!
customer_reviews.text: After four long years of weekly (sometimes daily) use in machine tool building, It has finally come time to retire this thing. The chuck is slipping. The batteries aren't holding charge as well as they used to. The power is fading. But, that said, this thing has put up a heck of a fight over the years. My DCD771C2 was great while it lasted. I just received my new DCD991 5AH kit, and I'm really looking forward to testing it out next week. RIP my tired old workhorse. I hope your successor performs as diligently as you did.
customer_reviews.author: Average

customer_reviews.title: Best 20 v drill I ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Well made drill/driver. Works great as a drill, which I never had luck with portable drills before. Powerful, light weight. 2 batteries is a major benefit. I see no negatives to this drill. Well packaged, rapid delivery. I can not see anything bad with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis E.

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions. It is very informative about this product
customer_reviews.text: This cordless drill driver is a name brand and I’ve used it a couple of times. I don’t know if when in high rotation mode and you stop suddenly it vibrates and you hear a loud rattling noise come from inside the drill. Don’t know if this is normal function of drill or not. I like that the second battery can stay in the charging slot. Even for weeks at a time. Keeping it fully charged. About the noise, anybody out there know one way or the other let me know with a addition to this review
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar Vogtmann

customer_reviews.title: Defective Batteries
customer_reviews.text: One of the batteries came defective. On a full charge it lasted less than 15 seconds as shown in the video taken 2 days after delivery. The other one suffered the same fate 90 days later (the convenient length of the money-back guarantee). The product support site doesn't support this item. There are hundreds of other reviews like this but they're getting buried since this product already has over 6k reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill. It came with 2 batteries, the drill, the charger and a carrying bag. The bag is pretty cheap quality, but I didn't really buy it for the bag. It's a really light weight, but still powerful drill. Works great for what I need it for for every day home maintenance. It is worth noting that it does not come with any drill bits. I think if it came with a basic phillips/flat head standard drill bit, I would give it a 5 star rating. I've always loved Dewalt's drills, and this one is no different.
customer_reviews.author: Jgarre0223

customer_reviews.title: If replacing original iMac/apple bluetooth keyboard...
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat price. Uses AAA batteries instead of AA. Letters/symbols on keys are 'stickers' on as opposed to printed. Biggest difference in original iMac/apple keyboard...bluetooth disconnects from the keyboard rather quickly when idle and then takes a few seconds to reconnect again when you are ready to type. The original keyboard stays connected to bluetooth indefinitely. I would guess this 'disconnect' saves battery life greatly. If you are used to performance of original keyboard this takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I will tell you so far I've been really impressed with this cordless driver. I haven't used it a lot yet, but so far the power is really nice and it gets the job done. Most small projects so far I haven't even had to switch batteries which is really impressive. It's funny going from a 18v nicad to 20v lithium sure makes a huge difference. The only reason I upgraded after all these years cause my 18v hit the ground and broke in half right where the trigger and switch forward/reverse is. Kinda sucked! This was a nice upgrade for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great drill!
customer_reviews.text: Such a reliable drill! The set comes with everything you need, aside from the bits of course. One battery lasts a long time and you can charge the one while the other one is in use. With the set, you can use the drill all day without worrying about running out of juice. I've build a coop that is 24x16 and 9' at it's peak. The attached image is the framing. It has since been completed. I would highly recommend this drill set for anybody who needs something reliable that would last all day.
customer_reviews.author: deadLOCC3D

customer_reviews.title: It's a DeWalt! What can I say?
customer_reviews.text: I've used DeWalt tools commercially for more than 3 decades and they have never let me down. This drill is no different from the rest when it comes to quality and dependability. It's compact and the light comes in handy for those darker areas where you don't have light or came hold a flashlight and use the drill at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Shaw, CPS

customer_reviews.title: Tried calling for days then after being on hold 2
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working properly FIRST USE!!! Tried multiple days to call... today, I waited on hold over TWO HOURS for them to just hang up!! All I wanted was replacement now will be my mission to tell everyone about how my product didn’t work & they refused to help consumer by not answering phone !! Should be able to talk to a human being. NEVER BUY FROM THEM AGAIN ! If you can’t back your product you are useless. (Tried call backs for days & NEVER GOT RETURN CALL)
customer_reviews.author: Ziva Carlson

customer_reviews.title: We thought it didn't work but....it was us!!!
customer_reviews.text: Because it had been so long since we originally used/purchased Amazon couldn't return. We made the drive to the big box stores to buy another...when we had the same problem of the drill not working (or bad batteries)) we realized it was us!! There is an extra "click" to totally secure the batteries...The drill is perfect. Amazon did try and trouble shoot and connect us to DeWalt support but Dealt never returned the call.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Binning

customer_reviews.title: Supreme longevity!!
customer_reviews.text: DEWALT does not disappoint, and this drill is the perfect example. I cannot believe how long the battery lasts without dying. I have gotten almost 3 hours of CONSECUTIVE use from these 2 batteries! And I mean, constant drilling and screwing with no rest and putting down the drill. If you're going to be casually using it throughout your day, it will easily last you more than the hours in the day.
customer_reviews.author: Rubark Established 2014

customer_reviews.title: I got a dud, returned it, and got another dud.
customer_reviews.text: This drill worked for a about 3 mins and died on me. I thought it was the battery so i switched it out. It worked for a few seconds and died again. I went to charge the batteries and discovered that they were both fully charged. This drill just doesnt work. Amazon sent me a replacement drill fairly quickly. I discovered that the same exact thing is wrong with this one as well. This is so disappointing. Two duds in a row. I always looked to dewalt for quality tools. Maybe look into other brands before buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Albert garcia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Dewalt Drill. Very disappointed. Battery didn’t even last simple TV mount project at fully charged. And I got replacements but with same battery issues. LED light stay on for long time. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: usa365

customer_reviews.title: Best value from a respected name. Performs as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced a Black & Decker 3/8, 18V that served well for many years. The new Dewalt 1/2, 20V has a similar feel and I especially like the bright LED light! Batteries charge quickly. Advertised as a 2 speed is a little misleading since on either setting it is variable speed like it should be. The heavy duty carry bag is a nice touch too! So far 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Morgan Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good to go, DeWalt!
customer_reviews.text: I bought just the bare tool since I already had the batteries from another impact driver. The drill overall is a good one. Since it’s not brushless, it does spark some and upon initial use I did get some burning smells, but it seems to just be the “breaking in” process. It’s worked great so far and has plenty of power for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Troy C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: i had two Black and Decker drills. First one was a 20th anniversary gift from my work, the second I bought used because it was like the first and also came with a battery. The B&D was the old battery tech and not all that good. However this Dewalt has two ion-lithium batteries which seems to supply much more power than the old tech. The drill itself has a 1/2 inch chuck which is bigger than cheaper drills. Good purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Great drill at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a bargain price. Plenty of power, solid construction and good battery life. It comes with 2 batteries which is an important feature. The batteries charge in about 30 minutes. The clutch is adjustable and also has a "fixed" position to obtain full torque. Though not as large or heavy duty as the red colored brand, this drill has never failed to provide me the torque needed to do what I had to do with it. I highly recommend this drill.
customer_reviews.author: Floogelfish

customer_reviews.title: A must for all homeowners!
customer_reviews.text: Great power drill! Has great power and lightweight. I love that it comes with a back-up battery pack so you can have an immediate back-up. It also comes with a bag. BUT you need to purchase the drill bit set separately. So don’t forget to do that. Too bad it didn’t even come with 1 to start with or I would have rated this a 5-star. Oh, I love also that it has a light!
customer_reviews.author: RRS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great deal! I thought it was a drill
customer_reviews.text: After moving into a house and abusing my tiny Makita 10v drills for a few months, it was time to get a big-boy drill. This is a great deal! I thought it was a drill, charger and battery. To my surprise, this includes TWO batteries! Just the batteries would be $100 so technically I'm getting a free drill and charger? Also, these batteries are swappable with all my other DeWalt products. The drill itself is great. It's powerful and controllable. This is not a hammer drill, but it has an adjustable clutch and smooth variable trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Katano

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service from Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: The drill is really good. I can imagine a better one but I have no complaints from this one. And the price makes it a no brainer. But the real reason for the 5 star review is Dewalt's stellar customer support. With the 12 month warranty, they have replaced both the charger (with an upgraded unit) and one of the batteries with no questions asked, no charge, free shipping, and it arrived in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Cambron

customer_reviews.title: Solid all the way around.
customer_reviews.text: Solid all the way around.This tool has been perfect and well-priced. A suggestion would be to have that little single-bit storage slot on the drill, with a double-ended straight/Philips bit. Those tips are just so commonly used, that it'd be nice not to have to open the bit box for quick jobs. That being said, I like the DeWalt bit box, and have several. My previous cordless drill had the single-bit storage slot, but it wasn't nearly as good overall as this drill. Overall, I am exceedingly happy with this drill, and would enthusiastically recommend it to anyone in need of such a tool.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyAngelo

customer_reviews.title: Great hand drill for any occasion
customer_reviews.text: This works great for small and large jobs alike. It's a solid build quality, the drill has lasted me a couple years and more than a few moves. The spare battery is great as you can quickly switch out the batteries and continue working as long as you plan ahead and charge a battery beforehand if the drill doesn't get a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: M S Mc Cright

customer_reviews.title: One star
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used the drill a hand full of times for light things like removing screws, when I actually needed it for a fence it decides it doesn't want to work. I've charged the battery over night and still nothing. Upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Ultra Instinct

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an electic drill with lithium batteries
customer_reviews.text: Ive been dealing with older drills with NiCad batteries and tired of them being dead when I needed them. When I had the opportunity to get this drill at a great price I leaped. Ive gotten rid of my NiCad drills and never looking back .....great drill with batteries that arent dead when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Tucci

customer_reviews.title: Chuck Does Not Hold Bits
customer_reviews.text: I have an older DeWalt drill and wanted to get a newer one to keep in our motorhome. This drill does not hold a bit tight. Trying to drill a hole and the chuck open and the drill bit either falls out or is so loose in the chuck that it stops turning. I like DeWalt products and I have several but this products is worthless. Don't waste your money on this drill.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Mesquite

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drill!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what an amazing tool! The last battery operated Drill that I bought was 15 years ago. Battery life has really changed not to mention batteries are much smaller now. This came with two batteries and one last almost a whole day with hard usage. I am buying one for a friend for Christmas
customer_reviews.author: terrie

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my power tool collection as I needed a second drill for jobs I do around the house (Impact driver and power drill). I love it like I do all my Dewalt products. Zero disappointment 100% satisfied. Cant go wrong with the price either. Came with two batteries. Batteries alone are almost the cost of the everything together.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Batteries or Charger Not Working
customer_reviews.text: I have had Dewalt tools in the past with no problems. This was to replace a Makita that I had had for many years. The charger said the batteries were fully charged but they died after setting three or four screws. I tried recharging them but the charger said they were fully charged. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Lash Ashmore

customer_reviews.title: I'm sold!
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill. I've used it to replace a mailbox and another item under the counter and have been very pleased. Admittedly, I haven't done a heavy duty project but the ease of use and handling has sold me. I had drill bits from an electric Dewalt drill which for perfectly. The light is a nice addition. Recommend it for home use for sure.
customer_reviews.author: mainer

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product
customer_reviews.text: Finally used this junk for a project, right out of its box. What a Waste of money for a big name. Battery lasts less than an hour on a very light duty job. The grip Chuck does not hold any bits, the torque setting is unreliable. a $ 47 Black and Decker with similar specification works 250% better than this junk. I really like to return it. But ...it may be too late.
customer_reviews.author: TJ49

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Dewalt cordless drill because of the quality of Dewalt tools and we are not disappointed. Everything from the features, batteries and ergonomic design to the power and rugged build you can’t ask for any more in a cordless drill. The two batteries last through many hours of use. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great solid home improvement cordless drill
customer_reviews.text: This drill meets my needs for home improvement projects. Awesome that is has two batteries and I feel like you get a good amount of use for each charge. I’ve never had them both depleted at the same time on a project. My only issue is that the torque seems like I have to back a screw out and rescrew it in even at the setting with the highest amount of torque. It has no additional accessories except a carrying bag, which I knew purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Joey S. Weber
